newsitem.title: USA: Brent crude deflates in late U.S. paper trading.
newsitem.headline: Brent crude deflates in late U.S. paper trading.

text.p: North Sea bellwether Brent crude shrank in late U.S. paper trading on Friday, traders said.
A series of partial July cargoes changed hands, beginning around $20.40 and winding down to $20.25 a barrel.
The July contract on London's IPE settled at $20.35 a barrel.
June/July Brent traded once at plus one cent a barrel, up a penny from a trade earlier in the day.
